question: [File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: sanitize_batch_total_limits()] [Label confusion] The error messages use labels like 'send_txns' but don't show actual values - can misleading error messages cause operators to misconfigure while thinking they fixed the issue? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: sanitize()] [Missing validations] The function only checks send/recv and batch/total limits - does it validate backpressure config, quotas, timeouts, or other critical parameters that could cause crashes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: sanitize()] [ChainId ignored] The sanitize function takes chain_id parameter but never uses it - can different chains require different validation rules that are not being enforced? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: sanitize()] [NodeType ignored] The node_type parameter is unused - should validators have stricter limits than fullnodes, and is this check missing allowing fullnodes to use validator-only configs? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: sanitize()] [Sequential validation] The two sanitization functions run sequentially - if the first one modifies the config before the second runs, can this create TOCTOU (time-of-check-time-of-use) vulnerabilities? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: sanitize()] [No backpressure validation] The sanitize function never validates QuorumStoreBackPressureConfig - can invalid backpressure settings cause crashes or security issues without being caught? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: sanitize()] [No quota validation] Memory quota, db quota, and batch quota are never validated - can setting them to 0 or usize::MAX cause critical failures that sanitization should catch? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: sanitize()] [No timeout validation] Timeout values (proof_timeout_ms, retry_interval_ms, etc.) are unchecked - can 0 or u64::MAX values cause infinite waits or immediate timeouts breaking consensus? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: sanitize()] [No worker validation] num_workers_for_remote_batches is not validated - can 0 workers or billions of workers cause operational failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: sanitize()] [Feature flag unchecked] Feature flags like enable_payload_v2 are not validated for consistency - can incompatible flag combinations cause consensus divergence? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Struct: QuorumStoreConfig] [Timing invariant] No validation ensures batch_generation_min_non_empty_interval_ms <= batch_generation_max_interval_ms - can reversed values deadlock batch generation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Struct: QuorumStoreConfig] [Channel vs batch count] No check ensures channel_size >= sender_max_num_batches - can trying to send more batches than channel capacity cause deadlocks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Struct: QuorumStoreConfig] [Quota vs batch size] No validation ensures memory_quota >= sender_max_total_bytes - can batches exceed quota capacity causing immediate quota exhaustion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Struct: QuorumStoreConfig] [Expiry timing] No check ensures batch_expiry_gap_when_init_usecs > batch_generation_max_interval_ms - can batches expire faster than they're created? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Struct: QuorumStoreConfig] [Request vs timeout] No validation that batch_request_rpc_timeout_ms > batch_request_retry_interval_ms - can retries happen before initial requests timeout causing duplicates? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Struct: QuorumStoreConfig] [Backpressure bounds] No check that backlog_txn_limit_count >= dynamic_max_txn_per_s * some_latency - can backpressure trigger before reaching target throughput? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Struct: QuorumStoreBackPressureConfig] [Fraction bounds] No validation that decrease_fraction is between 0.0 and 1.0 - can values outside this range cause mathematical errors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Struct: QuorumStoreBackPressureConfig] [Duration ratio] No check that increase_duration_ms and decrease_duration_ms are reasonable - can a 1:1000000 ratio break the algorithm? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Attribute: deny_unknown_fields] [Field injection] While deny_unknown_fields prevents extra fields, can a malicious config file use valid field names with extreme values to bypass sanitization if deserialization happens before validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Attribute: serde(default)] [Missing field attack] Can an attacker provide a config file with critical fields missing, causing serde to use default() values that may not be validated against other provided fields? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Type: usize] [Platform dependency] usize fields like channel_size are platform-dependent (32-bit vs 64-bit) - can configs created on 64-bit systems with huge values overflow on 32-bit systems? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Type: f64] [Float precision] The decrease_fraction uses f64 - can floating point precision errors accumulate over time causing the backpressure algorithm to drift from expected behavior? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Type: f64] [NaN/Infinity] Can decrease_fraction be set to NaN, Infinity, or -Infinity through malicious config files, causing all backpressure calculations to become NaN and fail? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: Default::default()] [Hardcoded constants] Default values are hardcoded - can changes in network conditions (more validators, higher TPS) make these defaults insecure over time without explicit updates? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: Default::default()] [Comment mismatch] Comment says 'TODO: on next release, remove BATCH_PADDING_BYTES' but code still uses it - can this deprecated padding cause security issues if removal is forgotten? (Low)
